text: <a href="../2-Timothy-2-1/" title="2 Timothy 2:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 Thou therefore, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.

<a href="../2-Timothy-2-2/" title="2 Timothy 2:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 And the things that thou hast heard of me among many witnesses, the same commit thou to faithful men, who shall be able to teach others also.
<a href="../2-Timothy-2-3/" title="2 Timothy 2:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 Thou therefore endure hardness, as a good soldier of Jesus Christ.

<a href="../2-Timothy-2-4/" title="2 Timothy 2:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 No man that warreth entangleth himself with the affairs of *this* life; that he may please him who hath chosen him to be a soldier.
<a href="../2-Timothy-2-5/" title="2 Timothy 2:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 And if a man also strive for masteries, *yet* is he not crowned, except he strive lawfully.
<a href="../2-Timothy-2-6/" title="2 Timothy 2:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 The husbandman that laboureth must be first partaker of the fruits.
<a href="../2-Timothy-2-7/" title="2 Timothy 2:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 Consider what I say; and the Lord give thee understanding in all things.
<a href="../2-Timothy-2-8/" title="2 Timothy 2:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 Remember that Jesus Christ of the seed of David was raised from the dead according to my gospel:
<a href="../2-Timothy-2-9/" title="2 Timothy 2:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 Wherein I suffer trouble, as an evil doer, *even* unto bonds; but the word of God is not bound.

<a href="../2-Timothy-2-10/" title="2 Timothy 2:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 Therefore I endure all things for the elect's sakes, that they may also obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.
<a href="../2-Timothy-2-11/" title="2 Timothy 2:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 *It is* a faithful saying: For if we be dead with *him*, we shall also live with *him*:
<a href="../2-Timothy-2-12/" title="2 Timothy 2:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 If we suffer, we shall also reign with *him*: if we deny *him*, he also will deny us:
<a href="../2-Timothy-2-13/" title="2 Timothy 2:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 If we believe not, *yet* he abideth faithful: he cannot deny himself.

<a href="../2-Timothy-2-14/" title="2 Timothy 2:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 Of these things put *them* in remembrance, charging *them* before the Lord that they strive not about words to no profit, *but* to the subverting of the hearers.

<a href="../2-Timothy-2-15/" title="2 Timothy 2:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 Study to shew thyself approved unto God, a workman that needeth not to be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth.
<a href="../2-Timothy-2-16/" title="2 Timothy 2:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 But shun profane *and* vain babblings: for they will increase unto more ungodliness.
<a href="../2-Timothy-2-17/" title="2 Timothy 2:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 And their word will eat as doth a canker: of whom is Hymenaeus and Philetus;

<a href="../2-Timothy-2-18/" title="2 Timothy 2:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 Who concerning the truth have erred, saying that the resurrection is past already; and overthrow the faith of some.

<a href="../2-Timothy-2-19/" title="2 Timothy 2:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 Nevertheless the foundation of God standeth sure, having this seal, The Lord knoweth them that are his. And, Let every one that nameth the name of Christ depart from iniquity.

<a href="../2-Timothy-2-20/" title="2 Timothy 2:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 But in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of earth; and some to honour, and some to dishonour.

<a href="../2-Timothy-2-21/" title="2 Timothy 2:21 KJV verse detail"><span id="23" class="versehover">21 If a man therefore purge himself from these, he shall be a vessel unto honour, sanctified, and meet for the master's use, *and* prepared unto every good work.

<a href="../2-Timothy-2-22/" title="2 Timothy 2:22 KJV verse detail"><span id="24" class="versehover">22 Flee also youthful lusts: but follow righteousness, faith, charity, peace, with them that call on the Lord out of a pure heart.
<a href="../2-Timothy-2-23/" title="2 Timothy 2:23 KJV verse detail"><span id="25" class="versehover">23 But foolish and unlearned questions avoid, knowing that they do gender strifes.

<a href="../2-Timothy-2-24/" title="2 Timothy 2:24 KJV verse detail"><span id="26" class="versehover">24 And the servant of the Lord must not strive; but be gentle unto all *men*, apt to teach, patient,

<a href="../2-Timothy-2-25/" title="2 Timothy 2:25 KJV verse detail"><span id="27" class="versehover">25 In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;

<a href="../2-Timothy-2-26/" title="2 Timothy 2:26 KJV verse detail"><span id="28" class="versehover">26 And *that* they may recover themselves out of the snare of the devil, who are taken captive by him at his will.
